greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Quintal Queens permutation of N: double (mod 5) each digit (0->0, 1->2, 2->4, 3->1, 4->3) of the base-5 representation of n-1, add one.
link: Index entries for sequences that are permutations of the natural numbers
maple: DoubleDigits := proc(n,b) local i; add((b^i)*((2*floor(n/(b^i))) mod b),i=0..floor(evalf(log[b](n+1)))+1); end;
xref: Inverse permutation: A065258. A065257[n] = A004515[n-1]+1. Cf. also A065186, A065188.
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, Oct 26 2001
